variants.Description in input context: The DJ-1 protein has a missense mutation resulting in the substitution of leucine (L) with proline (P) at position 10.

Material used.Material Name: HEK293 cells stably expressing DJ-1 protein
Material used.Description: The experiment was conducted using HEK293 cells stably expressing the DJ-1 protein.

Readout description.Result Description: The DJ-1 protein with the L10P mutation showed reduced protein stability and solubility.
The DJ-1 protein with the L10P mutation showed altered profiles and reduced solubility compared to wild-type protein.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed for each experiment.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate for size-exclusion chromatography and Western Blot experiments.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 protein was used as a positive control for each experiment.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control for size-exclusion chromatography and Western Blot experiments.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein stability greater than 80% and solubility greater than 90%

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein stability less than 50% and solubility less than 70%
